page.title: 05LOWER BOWDEN FARM 2
page.content: and Westbury Farm measures 134 acres divided into 72 acres for winter wheat, 50 acres of winter barley and 12 acres of grass. There are 234 cows (Friesian/Holstein) and 2 bulls. The average yield per cow per year is 5440 litres of milk. The young stock consists of 118 heifer calves, 30 limousin calves and 2 friesian steers kept due to illness as all friesian bull calves are normally sold at 3 weeks old. In winter the cows are kept in a big barn consisting of cubicles capable of holding 200-300 cows at a time. The 9 employees on the farm are: 1 manager, 1 secretary, 3 tractor drivers, 3 herdsmen and 1 calf rearer. The cows are fed on maize in winter; it is made into silage in the same way as the grass. The straw fed to the cattle is treated with caustic soda in
